about.title: About Klocking
about.lineOne: Klocking is a private, free, and open source time tracker.
about.lineTwo: I built it to improve my awareness of how I actually spend my life.
about.lineThree: There are plenty of time-tracking apps out there, but the vast majority:
list: Store your data in the cloud under questionable privacy policies
Collect too much information for a simple app
Are overly complex or cluttered, I don’t need that many features
about.lineFour: Klocking uses localStorage, which means all data you create stays local inside your browser. No one but your own device has access to it, and no one else can control it.
about.lineFive: Because there’s no backend to maintain, I don’t have to pay for servers, which keeps costs low and allows me to offer it completely free. I plan to keep it online indefinitely.
about.lineSix: (And if someday I can’t host it anymore, I’ll try to turn it into a desktop app first. The source code is also public on GitHub.)
about.lineSeven: Just keep in mind: you’re the only one responsible for your data. If you switch browsers or clear your cache, you might lose everything — so make sure to use the Export feature regularly to back it up.
